member.name: T:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration
member.summary: Configuration used for reading and writing CSV data.

member.summary: Gets or sets the .

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.TypeConverterCache
member.summary: Gets or sets the .

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.HasHeaderRecord
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the CSV file has a header record. Default is true.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.HeaderValidated
member.summary: Gets or sets the function that is called when a header validation check is ran. The default function will throw a if there is no header for a given member mapping. You can supply your own function to do other things like logging the issue instead of throwing an exception. Arguments: isValid, headerNames, headerNameIndex, context

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.MissingFieldFound
member.summary: Gets or sets the function that is called when a missing field is found. The default function will throw a . You can supply your own function to do other things like logging the issue instead of throwing an exception. Arguments: headerNames, index, context

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.BadDataFound
member.summary: Gets or sets the function that is called when bad field data is found. A field has bad data if it contains a quote and the field is not quoted (escaped). You can supply your own function to do other things like logging the issue instead of throwing an exception. Arguments: context

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.ReadingExceptionOccurred
member.summary: Gets or sets the function that is called when a reading exception occurs. The default function will re-throw the given exception. If you want to ignore reading exceptions, you can supply your own function to do other things like logging the issue. Arguments: exception

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.ShouldSkipRecord
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback that will be called to determine whether to skip the given record or not.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.SanitizeForInjection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if fields should be sanitized to prevent malicious injection. This covers MS Excel, Google Sheets and Open Office Calc.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.InjectionCharacters
member.summary: Gets or sets the characters that are used for injection attacks.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.InjectionEscapeCharacter
member.summary: Gets or sets the character used to escape a detected injection.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.DetectColumnCountChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether changes in the column count should be detected. If true, a will be thrown if a different column count is detected.
member.value: true if [detect column count changes]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.PrepareHeaderForMatch
member.summary: Prepares the header field for matching against a member name. The header field and the member name are both ran through this function. You should do things like trimming, removing whitespace, removing underscores, and making casing changes to ignore case.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.ShouldUseConstructorParameters
member.summary: Determines if constructor parameters should be used to create the class instead of the default constructor and members.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.GetConstructor
member.summary: Chooses the constructor to use for constuctor mapping.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.IgnoreReferences
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether references should be ignored when auto mapping. True to ignore references, otherwise false. Default is false.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.TrimOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the field trimming options.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.Delimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets the delimiter used to separate fields. Default is ",";

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.Quote
member.summary: Gets or sets the character used to quote fields. Default is '"'.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.QuoteString
member.summary: Gets a string representation of the currently configured Quote character.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.DoubleQuoteString
member.summary: Gets a string representation of two of the currently configured Quote characters.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.QuoteRequiredChars
member.summary: Gets an array characters that require the field to be quoted.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.Comment
member.summary: Gets or sets the character used to denote a line that is commented out. Default is '#'.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.AllowComments
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if comments are allowed. True to allow commented out lines, otherwise false.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.BufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the buffer used for reading CSV files. Default is 2048.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.QuoteAllFields
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether all fields are quoted when writing, or just ones that have to be. and cannot be true at the same time. Turning one on will turn the other off.
member.value: true if all fields should be quoted; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.QuoteNoFields
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether no fields are quoted when writing. and cannot be true at the same time. Turning one on will turn the other off.
member.value: true if [quote no fields]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.CountBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the number of bytes should be counted while parsing. Default is false. This will slow down parsing because it needs to get the byte count of every char for the given encoding. The needs to be set correctly for this to be accurate.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding used when counting bytes.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.CultureInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture info used to read an write CSV files.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.IgnoreQuotes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if quotes should be ignored when parsing and treated like any other character.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.IncludePrivateMembers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if private member should be read from and written to. True to include private member, otherwise false. Default is false.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.MemberTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the member types that are used when auto mapping. MemberTypes are flags, so you can choose more than one. Default is Properties.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.IgnoreBlankLines
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if blank lines should be ignored when reading. True to ignore, otherwise false. Default is true.

member.name: P:CsvHelper.Configuration.Configuration.ReferenceHeaderPrefix
